title: 12 Mass. towns missed the MBTA Communities zoning deadline. What happens now?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Local News Twelve towns failed to comply with the MBTA Communities Act by the end of 2025.
Now they face legal threats, lost funding, and deep uncertainty.
The Avalon Apartments lie right next to the Norwood MBTA commuter train station.

title: Patriots’ ‘big dogs’ on defense shredded Chargers en route to a playoff victory
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “He started the week by saying, ‘Big dogs show up in January.
’ And I was just preaching that to our group all week.
" Milton Williams and the Patriots doled out six sacks against the Chargers.

title: Christian Gonzalez’s playoff debut ended early after head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Gonzalez did not allow any completions on Sunday, but a head injury ended his night early.
Christian Gonzalez during the Patriots' playoff win.

title: How Drake Maye assessed his first playoff game for the Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I didn't throw very well tonight.
Need to be better.

title: How Mike Vrabel ended up with a bloody lip during Patriots’ playoff win over the Chargers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I think I headbutted everybody.
But I forgot Vrabes ain't have no helmet on.
" Mike Vrabel took a football helmet to the face during Sunday's win.

title: The best jokes and brutal roasts from Nikki Glaser’s Golden Globes monologue
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Entertainment Nikki Glaser returned to host the Golden Globes for a second straight year, poking fun at CBS News, Leonardo DiCaprio, and most of all, herself.
Nikki Glaser arrives at the 83rd Golden Globes on Sunday, Jan.
11, 2026, at the Beverly Hilton in Beverly Hills, Calif.

title: ‘Egregious’: Allston bar shut down over repeated underage drinking violations
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News A Boston police detective said upwards of 100 people hurried out from the Allston bar one night after realizing officers were checking IDs.
The Draft Bar and Grille in Allston has its liquor license suspended indefinitely on Jan.
8 after the Boston Licensing Board found repeated underage drinking violations.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Chargers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots It was a bit of a bizarre game for the Patriots on offense.
Milton Williams sacks Justin Herbert during the Patriots' playoff win.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff FOXBOROUGH — The Sunday night battle between Drake Maye and Justin Herbert wound up being a low-scoring affair, and the momentum swung in the Patriots’ favor during the second half after a lackluster start.

title: Man facing assault charges after other man injured in fight during Bruins game at TD Garden
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News Aaron Tucker, 49, is charged with assault and battery resulting in serious bodily injury, and assault and battery against 60+/disabled.
A man was arrested Saturday after a fight during a Bruins game at TD Garden that led to another man being hospitalized with a head injury, police said.

The man arrested, identified by police as Aaron Tucker, 49, is set to be arraigned at Boston Municipal Court Monday on charges of assault and battery resulting in serious bodily injury, and assault and battery against a 60+ or disabled victim, according to a Boston police report.
